caption.p:
Effect on cAMP‐mediated signaling in prefrontal cortex neurons. HCN channel opening shunts synaptic inputs onto dendritic spines and reduces strength of prefrontal cortex network activity. cAMP opens HCN channel that decreases the efficacy of cortical inputs. Adaptogens downregulate AC and upregulate PDE that decreases cAMP level in brain cells followed by closing of HCN channel. That increases efficacy of synaptic imputes, neuronal activity and working memory.
23 cAMP, cyclic adenosine monophosphate; HCN, hyperpolarization‐activated channels [Color figure can be viewed at wileyonlinelibrary.com]
